availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: C. A. Duncan (Calloway County, KY, boarding house owner, sheriff, and prov govt)

body.p: Calloway County, Kentucky, sheriff and boarding house proprietor. North Carolina native. Married to Elizabeth Duncan. Father of Christ Duncan, Abner Duncan, Naomi Duncan, Laura Duncan, and Abner Duncan. Owned three enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1850. Sheriff in Calloway County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1860. Boarding house proprietor in Calloway County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Appointed assistant quartermaster in the 3rd Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) on November 20, 1862.

ab.bibl:
